comment:
DON'T TAKE HER. 
I had her in high school and she still sucks. She doesn't even teach the class, she just uses delta-math. When I took College algebra with a good professor it was so much easier. I can agree with the other reviews that if you happen to be absent or unable to attend class, you might return to find that she has built a rocket.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She is super nice and cares about her students. If you miss a class just watch Professor Leonard on youtube and you'll be fine. There is homework but she gives you plenty of time and the quizzes come with bonus opportunities on your exams so try not to skip class. Her tests are not too difficult if you study well and she gives partial credit.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I know there are a lot of bad ratings for her, but honestly she is a great professor and cares about all the students. She makes mistakes during notes sometimes but if you politely correct her, she will fix it. I wouldn't recommend skipping, as there is a quiz every day you enter class, but she really is great. The class is fast paced though.

If you're good at math, you'll get an A. A lot of people who are bad at math struggled in her class. She moves quickly and sometimes is confusing/doesn't explain things well. Get a buddy who's good at math and you'll do fine. Gives you a packet to fill in your HW answers for a grade periodically.
DON'T take her
I like her. She is nice
Moves quickly
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Gammill is one of the worst teachers I've ever had. She makes easy material far harder than it has to be and is awful at explaining. Her homework is extremely difficult and does not relates to anything shes taught. Each test has random concepts that you've never seen in lectures or homework. You will be miserable.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: I love Dr. Gammil. She is a great teacher if you are average at math. She knows what she's talking about and will answer any question you have. She gives many examples, gives a study guide and goes over it before the test. There's one homework assignment due each unit, about 20 questions. About one quiz each unit.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She is not a mean person, but is not built to be a college professor (She used to teach high school). She struggles to explain things adequately and her exams are very difficult. PLEASE AVOID AT ALL COSTS. NOT WORTH IT AT ALL.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: Not worth taking the class, drop out

Awful. Not knowledgeable, but with endless demands towards the students. The length of her tests and quizzes is unrealistic for the time given to do , she  knows is it and enjoys seeing you fail. She makes mistakes when she solves problems and gets irritated when somebody ask a question, tries to be funny, but actually is insulting.

This is the only class I've ever pulled an all-nighter studying for a test and gotten less than a 20% on it.  The difficulty level of her class is ridiculous.  I can't do to the bathroom during class because I know if I get up, when I get back we will have learned how to build a rocket or something outrageously difficult. Blinking is even risky
awful
This class makes me so sad.  I am going to fail because she is awful.  She makes it way harder than it needs to be.  Don't take her class unless you hate yourself and enjoy being stressed
It is what it is

Do not take her. She goes way to fast, and gets aggravated when students don't understand. She pretty much starts off the first class by telling you that it Is going to be very hard to pass. She often puts material that you have never seen on test, and she is a very tough grader

She was not a horrible teacher, but you definitely have to but in a lot of work in order to receive an A. At the beginning of the semester I took her class for granted because I took pre-calc in high school. Please don't be like me. She teaches the material a whole lot faster, but she does make her self available for extra help after class.

I would definitely recommend her.  She is really nice and gives many opportunities for you to learn the material.  It is a little fast paced but she does her best to make sure everyone understands.  She is also a high school teacher so she sometimes teaches like it, but if you are having a hard time understanding the material, this can help.

Mrs. Gammill is not a helpful teacher at all. If you ask her for help she looks at you like she is crazy. She expects you to know the work. She gives quizzes every week, and sometimes when she gives the quizzes she hasn't even went over the material on the quiz. She make the tests short so you can fail. She rarely give study guides on the test.
